page.title: 14The old railway at Bubwith
page.content: The railway came to Bubwith in 1848 and the station closed on 20th. September 1954.The old railway line is now a footpath as far as Holme upon Spalding Moor (east of the River Derwent). A most interesting relic is the{old viaduct}that crosses the river near Bubwith. Two years ago several of the arches were dismantled for safety reasons. On walking eastwards from the viaduct you pass through{Dingle Dell Nature {Reserve,}which is used a lot by the local people for walking dogs and playing. Few remnants of the old railway can be seen: the cinder track, two old gate posts,and signal box remain. Several old items are kept at the old station house, and the old station can be seen.
